headline: Majority of Russian miners are operating outside the law
summary: Efforts to legalize the activities of crypto miners in Russia haven‚Äôt been particularly fruitful and only about 30% have so far registered with the country‚Äôs tax authority. The assessment comes from the finance ministry in Moscow, which says it‚Äôs working to bring the rest of the growing industry out of the shadows, the main purpose of regulating the sector. Majority of Russian miners minting outside the law Less than a third of all Russian entities involved in cryptocurrency mining have been added to the special register of the Federal Tax Service (FNS) which allows them to operate legally, according to the Ministry of Finance (Minfin). The legalization of the Bitcoin-related business, which has been expanding in the energy-rich Russian Federation, is far from complete, Deputy Finance Minister Ivan Chebeskov told Russia‚Äôs state-owned news agency TASS. ‚ÄúOur general approach, when we introduced regulation, was to bring this industry out of the shadows as much as possible,‚Äù Chebeskov reminded. Also quoted by Russian crypto media outlets Bits.media and RBC Crypto, he admitted: ‚ÄúSo far, only 30% of all miners have entered the register maintained by the FNS, and this process is still far from complete.‚Äù The Minfin official emphasized his department will continue work to legalize the remaining two-thirds of the crypto mining sector. These efforts started last year when Russia adopted legislation designed to regulate the crypto activity. Since the new law entered into force in November 2024, companies and individual entrepreneurs can mine legally as long as they register with the Russian tax authority and pay due taxes . Private citizens minting digital currencies are not required to do that, as long as they use less than 6,000 kWh of electricity monthly. The FNS registry was launched in January and by April 1, registration entries had reached 722, including 116 ‚Äúmining infrastructure operators,‚Äù or providers of hosting services and data center operators. Krasnoyarsk Krai, Irkutsk Oblast and the Republic of Tatarstan account of the highest number legal miners in Russia. Fines and crypto seizure await illegal crypto miners Many miners prefer to remain in the shadow economy as they fear criminal prosecution over illegally imported equipment, RBC noted in its report. According to the business news portal, an amnesty is already being discussed between legislators and industry members. Those who decide to continue to mine illegally are going to face heavy fines and other punitive measures, including confiscation of the minted cryptocurrency. According to amendments to Russia‚Äôs Code of Administrative Offenses, currently under consideration, the monetary penalties may reach 2 million rubles ($25,000) for companies and 400,000 rubles ($5,000) for private individuals. Russia mulls lower electricity rates for legal mining farms Illegal, also called ‚Äúgray‚Äù crypto miners in Russia have been blamed for increasing electricity deficits in a number of Russian regions. Authorities have reacted by banning all mining in almost a dozen territories and subjects of the Russian Federation. Critics say this hurts legal mining businesses, bringing down tax revenues and electricity sales. ‚ÄúWe need to regulate mining, not ban it,‚Äù Russia‚Äôs Deputy Energy Minister Evgeny Grabchak was quoted as stating on the sidelines of the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum. Speaking to TASS, he elaborated: ‚ÄúThe Ministry of Energy sees the point not in prohibition, but in more subtle regulation of mining.‚Äù Earlier in June, Grabchak told reporters that his department favors regulatory changes that will help avoid restrictions on cryptocurrency mining in some parts of the country and is working on incentives to attract miners to regions with surplus energy. Now he revealed these may include offering take-or-pay tariffs for the electricity consumed by legal mining farms. He noted the rates ‚Äúwon‚Äôt be much lower, but they will be more long-term.‚Äù In May, he hinted on adding miners to a separate category of consumers enjoying lower energy prices that will apply across all Russian regions. headline: XRP Traders Panic: Bearish Sentiment Dominates Amid Middle East Tensions
summary: BitcoinWorld XRP Traders Panic: Bearish Sentiment Dominates Amid Middle East Tensions Global events have a powerful ripple effect, and the world of cryptocurrency is no exception. Recently, the escalating situation involving Middle East tensions has sent shivers through financial markets, including the digital asset space. For many, the focus is squarely on how this uncertainty impacts their portfolios, and specifically, what it means for the XRP price . What Are XRP Traders Doing Amid the Uncertainty? According to reports, particularly from DL News, XRP traders are reacting to the geopolitical climate by bracing for potential declines. The derivatives exchange Deribit has reportedly seen increased activity from traders taking bearish positions on XRP. This means they are essentially betting that the XRP price will fall further. These traders are anticipating a notable drop, with some positioning for an additional 5% decrease in XRP‚Äôs value. This isn‚Äôt just random speculation; it reflects a growing bearish sentiment specifically targeting XRP in the wake of heightened global risk. Why are XRP traders so sensitive to this news? Geopolitical instability often leads investors to move away from riskier assets. Cryptocurrencies, while sometimes seen as uncorrelated, frequently react negatively to events that threaten global stability or signal potential economic disruption. How Are Middle East Tensions Shaking the Crypto Market? The connection between Middle East tensions and the crypto market might not be immediately obvious, but it‚Äôs a significant one. Major geopolitical events introduce uncertainty and increase risk aversion among investors worldwide. When tensions escalate: Investors seek safety: Capital tends to flow out of assets perceived as risky (like stocks and cryptocurrencies) and into safer havens (like government bonds or gold). Economic outlook darkens: Conflict can disrupt supply chains, impact energy prices, and generally create a less favorable environment for economic growth, dampening enthusiasm for speculative assets. Policy responses: Governments and central banks might signal policy shifts in response to the crisis, further influencing market direction. The recent signals from U.S. President Donald Trump regarding potential U.S. involvement added another layer of complexity and concern, amplifying the market‚Äôs reaction. This isn‚Äôt just affecting XRP; the broader crypto market , including giants like Bitcoin and Ethereum, has also experienced declines, demonstrating the systemic impact of these global events. Decoding the Bearish Sentiment: Why Are Traders Betting Down? The prevailing bearish sentiment among XRP traders isn‚Äôt solely tied to geopolitical fears, although that‚Äôs a major catalyst right now. Bearish sentiment reflects a collective expectation that an asset‚Äôs price is likely to fall. Several factors contribute to this outlook: Geopolitical Risk: As discussed, escalating Middle East tensions are a primary driver, increasing overall market fear. Macroeconomic Headwinds: Broader concerns about inflation, interest rates, and potential recession can contribute to risk-off attitudes. Technical Analysis: Traders often look at price charts and patterns. If XRP‚Äôs chart shows signs of weakness or breaks key support levels, it can reinforce a bearish view. Market Contagion: When major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin experience declines, it often pulls altcoins like XRP down with them, regardless of their individual fundamentals. The weakness in the broader crypto market contributes significantly to the negative outlook for XRP. Specific XRP Factors: While less prominent in this specific report, ongoing regulatory discussions or developments related to Ripple‚Äôs legal status can also influence sentiment around the XRP price . The accumulation of these factors can create a powerful wave of bearish sentiment , leading traders to open short positions or sell their holdings in anticipation of lower prices. Broader Crypto Market Reaction: Is It Just XRP? While the report highlights XRP traders specifically, it‚Äôs crucial to understand that the reaction is not isolated. The entire crypto market is interconnected and sensitive to major external shocks. Bitcoin, as the market leader, often dictates the overall trend. When Bitcoin sees selling pressure due to global events or macro fears, altcoins like XRP, Ethereum, and others typically follow suit, often with greater volatility. The declines observed in Bitcoin and Ethereum following the news signals underscore that the current downturn is a market-wide phenomenon, triggered by the same underlying fear driven by Middle East tensions . This collective movement reinforces the bearish sentiment across the board, impacting the XRP price as part of the larger ecosystem. Navigating the Volatility: Actionable Insights for XRP Traders Trading during times of heightened volatility and bearish sentiment can be challenging, but informed decisions are key. Here are some actionable insights for XRP traders : Risk Management is Paramount: Never invest more than you can afford to lose. Use stop-loss orders to limit potential downside if the XRP price moves against your position. Stay Informed, Avoid Panic: Keep track of geopolitical developments and market analysis, but avoid making impulsive decisions based on fear or hype. Understand Middle East tensions are a factor, but not the only one. Consider Diversification: Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket. While focusing on XRP, ensure your overall portfolio is diversified across different assets or even different sectors within crypto. Understand Derivatives Risk: If you are trading derivatives like those on Deribit, be acutely aware of the leverage involved and the potential for rapid losses, especially with significant bearish sentiment in play. Look for Opportunities (with caution): Volatility can present opportunities for those with a strategy. This might involve shorting (betting on price decline) if you are experienced, or identifying potential entry points if you believe the long-term outlook for the XRP price remains positive despite short-term headwinds. However, timing the market is extremely difficult. Re-evaluate Your Thesis: Step back and consider if the current situation fundamentally changes your long-term view on XRP and the crypto market . For many, observing from the sidelines during extreme uncertainty might be the most prudent strategy. The goal is to preserve capital and be ready when clearer trends emerge. Summary: Geopolitics Casts a Shadow on XRP and the Crypto Market In conclusion, the report highlighting XRP traders positioning for declines underscores the significant impact of global events, particularly Middle East tensions , on the digital asset space. The growing bearish sentiment is a direct response to the increased risk and uncertainty introduced by the geopolitical climate and broader market reactions. While XRP price is specifically mentioned due to trader positioning on platforms like Deribit, this reflects a wider trend affecting the entire crypto market , including Bitcoin and Ethereum. Navigating these turbulent times requires careful consideration, robust risk management, and a clear understanding of how external factors can influence the volatile world of cryptocurrency trading. headline: AgriFORCE Powers 120 Bitcoin Mining Rigs With Stranded Natural Gas in Alberta
summary: AgriFORCE Unveils Natural Gas-Fueled Bitcoin Mining Facility in Alberta Canadian agriculture company AgriFORCE Growing Systems Ltd. unveiled a new facility using stranded natural gas to power 120 Bitcoin mining machines. The Berwyn, Alberta-based facility was unveiled with BlueFlare Energy and is now running on 425 kilowatts (kW), delivering a hashrate of 32 petahashes per second (PH/s). Stranded gas refers to natural gas that is not able to be delivered to market due to logistics or economics. AgriFORCE‚Äôs process enables unused gas to be turned into computer power without having to navigate the years-long permitting and infrastructure bottleneck. Two Additional Sites Planned Across Alberta AgriFORCE has executed a binding letter of intent with BlueFlare Energy to expand its model of mining into two new sites in Oyen and Hinton, Alberta. The new sites would be a carbon copy of the Berwyn model, further expanding the company‚Äôs foray into gas-powered crypto mining. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt wait on permits or grid upgrades ‚Äî we convert gas to compute in weeks, not years,‚Äù CEO Jolie Kahn said. AgriFORCE‚Äôs Bitcoin Strategy: Hold and Expand The company revealed that it has mined already 7 Bitcoin with an approximate value of $735,000 from operations in Alberta and Ohio. The mined BTC of up to 50% of AgriFORCE will be reserved in treasury while the balance will be employed to facilitate operational expansion. The company may also utilize up to 50% of funds raised to directly buy Bitcoin. Stock Performance and Financial Outlook AgriFORCE shares (AGRI) rose 1.85% to finish trading on Tuesday at $1.10. While there was the daily gain, the company is down over 53% year to date, according to Google Finance. Still, the company produced solid financials in 2024, with revenue jumping 317% and net profit increasing 66% year over year. Renewable Energy Picks Up Speed in Crypto Mining AgriFORCE is part of a broader trend within the crypto mining industry: shifting to alternative and renewable sources of energy. According to TheMinerMag, the price of one BTC to produce in Q1 2025 hit $64,000 and will rise to $70,000 by the end of Q2. With increased energy prices, miners are looking more towards renewable resources. A new report showed a growth in the adoption of renewable energy by Bitcoin miners at 5.8% per year, while reliance on coal is gradually reducing.

headline: Ohio Crypto Tax Breakthrough: State House Approves $200 Exemption Bill
summary: BitcoinWorld Ohio Crypto Tax Breakthrough: State House Approves $200 Exemption Bill Big news out of the Buckeye State! The Ohio House of Representatives has taken a significant step that could make small cryptocurrency transactions much simpler for residents. In a move that has captured the attention of the crypto community, lawmakers in Ohio have passed a bill aiming to exempt certain cryptocurrency transactions from capital gains tax. This development is particularly relevant for anyone engaging in frequent, small-value trades or using crypto for minor purchases in the state. Understanding the Proposed Ohio Crypto Tax Exemption At the heart of this legislative effort is the desire to ease the tax burden and reporting complexity associated with small cryptocurrency transactions. Currently, under federal and typically state law, selling, trading, or using cryptocurrency for goods and services can trigger a taxable event. If the value of the crypto has increased since you acquired it, you could owe capital gains tax on that appreciation, even on very small amounts. The bill recently passed by the Ohio House seeks to create an exemption for this. Specifically, it targets transactions where the gain realized is less than $200. This means if you buy crypto, and later sell it, trade it for another crypto, or use it to buy something, and the profit (the difference between the sale price and your cost basis) is less than $200, that specific gain would be exempt from state capital gains tax in Ohio. This is a crucial detail ‚Äì the exemption applies to the *gain*, not the total transaction value. Let‚Äôs break down what this exemption aims to address: Micro-Transactions: Using crypto for everyday purchases, like buying a coffee or a small item, can currently create complex tax reporting obligations for tiny gains. Frequent Small Trades: Active traders making many small profitable trades face a significant tracking burden. Tax Complexity: Many users find calculating and reporting capital gains tax on crypto confusing, especially for small amounts. By introducing this exemption, Ohio lawmakers hope to remove some of these hurdles, potentially encouraging greater use and adoption of cryptocurrencies within the state without creating unintended tax headaches for minor activities. What is the Ohio Blockchain Basics Act? The bill carrying this significant crypto tax exemption is formally known as the Ohio Blockchain Basics Act. While the tax provision is a headline feature, the act‚Äôs name suggests it might encompass broader legislative efforts related to blockchain technology and digital assets within the state. Legislation labeled as ‚ÄòBasics Acts‚Äô often aims to establish foundational legal definitions, rights, and frameworks for emerging technologies. The passage of this act in the House with a strong 70-26 vote indicates significant bipartisan support for creating a more favorable environment for blockchain and cryptocurrencies in Ohio. It signals that state legislators are actively considering how to integrate these technologies into the existing legal and economic structure, starting with fundamental issues like taxation. While the full text of the bill likely covers more than just the tax exemption, this specific provision is the most immediately impactful for individual cryptocurrency users. It positions Ohio as one of the states exploring ways to adapt its tax code to the unique nature of digital assets and the potential for frequent, low-value transactions. How Does This Impact Cryptocurrency Tax Reporting for Ohio Residents? If this bill becomes law, it would directly affect how Ohio residents calculate and report their state-level capital gains tax related to crypto. Currently, any gain, no matter how small, is technically subject to tax and reporting requirements. The proposed exemption would create a specific carve-out. Consider these scenarios: Scenario A: You bought 0.01 ETH for $200. Later, you sell it for $210. Your gain is $10. Under the proposed law, this $10 gain would likely be exempt from Ohio state capital gains tax. Scenario B: You bought 0.1 BTC for $3,000. Later, you sell it for $3,250. Your gain is $250. Since this gain is over the $200 threshold, the full $250 gain would still be subject to Ohio state capital gains tax. Scenario C: You use 0.005 BTC (which you acquired for $100) to buy a $150 item. At the time of the transaction, that 0.005 BTC was worth $150. Your gain is $50 ($150 value received ‚Äì $100 cost basis). This $50 gain would likely be exempt. Important Note: This exemption, if enacted, would only apply to Ohio state capital gains tax. Federal capital gains tax rules, which currently do not have such a de minimis exemption for crypto, would still apply. Ohio residents would still need to track all transactions for federal reporting purposes. The primary benefit here is reducing the state-level tax liability and potentially simplifying state tax filings for those with only small crypto gains. However, the need for diligent record-keeping doesn‚Äôt disappear entirely, as users still need to determine if a gain exceeds the $200 threshold and track their cost basis for all transactions for federal tax purposes. The Road Ahead: Senate and Governor‚Äôs Desk Passing the House is a significant hurdle cleared, but the Ohio Blockchain Basics Act is not yet law. The bill must now make its way through the Ohio State Senate. The Senate will review the bill, potentially hold committee hearings, and may propose amendments before holding a vote. If the Senate passes the bill, it will then head to the desk of Governor Mike DeWine for his signature. The Governor has the power to sign the bill into law, veto it, or allow it to become law without his signature after a certain period. Given the strong House vote, there is positive momentum, but passage in the Senate and approval by the Governor are still necessary steps. The legislative process can be complex, and the exact timeline is uncertain. Those interested in seeing this crypto tax exemption become law should follow its progress through the Senate. Why is This Crypto Tax Exemption Significant for Ohio? This move by the Ohio House is more than just a tax tweak; it‚Äôs a statement. It signals that Ohio is serious about understanding and potentially fostering the growth of the blockchain and cryptocurrency industries within its borders. By addressing one of the major pain points for crypto users ‚Äì the complexity of tax reporting on small gains ‚Äì the state aims to make engaging with digital assets less cumbersome. Potential benefits for Ohio include: Attracting Innovation: A clear and favorable regulatory environment, even on tax matters, can make Ohio more attractive to blockchain companies and developers. Encouraging Adoption: Reducing the tax burden on small transactions could encourage more residents and businesses to use crypto for payments or small investments. Setting a Precedent: Ohio could become an example for other states looking to modernize their tax laws for digital assets. While a $200 exemption might seem modest in the context of large crypto investments, it directly impacts the most frequent types of transactions and the broadest base of users who might be experimenting with or using crypto for minor purposes. It‚Äôs a practical step that addresses a real-world friction point. Potential Criticisms or Challenges Despite the positive reception from many in the crypto community, the bill isn‚Äôt without potential points of discussion or criticism: Limited Scope: The $200 gain threshold is relatively low compared to the potential value of larger crypto holdings. It primarily benefits those with small gains. Tracking Still Required: Users still need to track their cost basis and sale price for *all* transactions to determine if a gain occurred and whether it falls under the $200 threshold for state exemption. This doesn‚Äôt eliminate the need for good record-keeping. Federal vs. State Discrepancy: Having different rules for state and federal tax can add another layer of complexity for taxpayers and tax professionals. These points highlight that while the bill is a step forward, the landscape of cryptocurrency tax remains complex, and users must stay informed and maintain meticulous records regardless of exemption thresholds. What Actionable Insights Should Ohio Residents Take? For cryptocurrency holders in Ohio, the most important takeaway right now is to stay informed. The bill has passed the House but is not yet law. Keep an eye on its progress through the Senate and towards the Governor‚Äôs office. Regardless of the bill‚Äôs final status, continue to practice diligent record-keeping for all your cryptocurrency transactions. This includes recording: The date of the transaction The type of cryptocurrency The number of units bought, sold, or traded The value of the transaction in U.S. dollars at the time Your cost basis (the price you paid for the crypto) The nature of the transaction (buy, sell, trade, spend) Using crypto tax software or maintaining a detailed spreadsheet can be invaluable. If the bill becomes law, you will need these records to identify which gains, if any, qualify for the state exemption. Conclusion: A Positive Step for Ohio Crypto Tax The passage of the Ohio Blockchain Basics Act, including its crypto tax exemption for gains under $200, by the State House is a significant and positive development for the cryptocurrency ecosystem in Ohio. It demonstrates a legislative willingness to address practical challenges faced by individuals engaging with digital assets and positions the state as forward-thinking in its approach to blockchain technology. While the bill still has further steps to clear before becoming law, its progress reflects growing recognition among policymakers of the need to adapt tax regulations to the realities of the digital economy. This move could encourage greater participation in the crypto space within Ohio and potentially inspire similar legislative efforts in other states, contributing to a clearer and more favorable regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies nationwide. headline: Only 30% of Russian crypto miners registered, says finance ministry

Unknown block type "divider", specify a component for it in the `components.types` option Crypto Taxes Are Complicated, Don‚Äôt Let Them Derail Your Portfolio As advisors focused on crypto, we‚Äôre familiar with the unique tax situations this asset class presents. For example, crypto is not subject to wash-sale rules, which allows for more efficient tax-loss harvesting. It also enables direct asset swaps, such as converting bitcoin (BTC) to ether (ETH) or ETH to Solana (SOL), without first selling into cash. These are just a couple of features that set crypto apart from traditional investments. However, perhaps the most important thing for investors to consider is the sheer number of platforms they may use and how challenging it can be to track everything at tax time. Tracking your crypto taxes isn‚Äôt just a year-end chore; it‚Äôs a year-round challenge, especially if you‚Äôre active on multiple centralized exchanges (CEXs) or decentralized platforms (DEXs). Every trade, swap, airdrop, staking reward, or bridging event can be a taxable event. Centralized Exchange Trading When using CEXs like Coinbase, Binance, or Kraken, you may receive year-end tax summaries, but those are often incomplete or inconsistent across platforms. One major challenge is tracking your cost basis across exchanges. For example, if you buy Amazon stock in a Fidelity account and transfer it to Schwab, your cost basis transfers seamlessly and updates with each new trade. At tax time, Schwab can generate an accurate 1099 showing your gains and losses. But in crypto, if you transfer assets from Kraken to Coinbase, your cost basis doesn‚Äôt automatically transfer with them. If you‚Äôre moving assets across multiple platforms, you‚Äôll need to manually track every transaction, or you‚Äôll face a major headache when filing taxes. Decentralized Exchange Trading Things get even more complicated when using DEXs. Apps like Coinbase Wallet (not to be confused with the Coinbase exchange) or Phantom connect you to decentralized trading platforms like Uniswap or Jupiter. These DEXs don‚Äôt issue tax forms or track your cost basis, so it‚Äôs entirely up to you to log and reconcile every transaction. Miss a single token swap or forget to record the fair market value of a liquidity pool withdrawal, and your tax report could be inaccurate. That could trigger IRS scrutiny or lead to missed deductions. While some apps can calculate gains and losses from a single wallet address, they often struggle when assets are transferred between addresses, making them less useful for active users. And here‚Äôs the kicker: if you‚Äôre actively trading on DEXs, chances are you‚Äôre not even making money. But even losses must be reported correctly to qualify for a deduction. If not, you risk losing the write-off or, worse, facing an audit. Unless you‚Äôre a full-time crypto trader, the time and effort required to track every transaction isn‚Äôt just stressful, it can cost you real money. What steps can I take to make sure I'm tax ready? There are, however, several ways to prepare properly for crypto taxes: Use crypto tax software from the beginning. Even then, you‚Äôll want to double-check that the reported activity makes sense and adjust as needed. Hire a crypto tax specialist or work with a crypto-focused advisor who understands the landscape. Download all transaction logs and see if your CPA or advisor can help build a cost basis and determine your realized gains and losses. So that‚Äôs the future.‚Äù This expansion will allow people to pay for goods, tip creators, and make trades on the same platform they already use for content. X plans US rollout of X Money and financial tools X is rolling out its financial services in stages. First up is X Money, a new digital wallet and peer-to-peer payment system that will launch in the United States before expanding to other countries. Linda said X Money will support functions like tipping, saving, and buying things directly in the app. X is also partnering with Visa to back the payment system and plans to add an X-branded credit or debit card as early as this year. Elon bought the company, then called Twitter, in 2022 for $44 billion. Linda said this new expansion isn‚Äôt just about payments. She said: ‚ÄúA whole commerce ecosystem and a financial ecosystem is going to emerge on the platform that does not exist today.‚Äù But adding financial tools means X has to face regulatory challenges. Services like stock trading, crypto transfers, and payments come with licensing issues, money laundering laws, and compliance requirements that are far stricter than anything the company has dealt with before. That hasn‚Äôt stopped Elon from pushing forward. At the same time, X is still trying to fix its ad revenue problem. After Elon‚Äôs takeover, most of the platform‚Äôs advertisers pulled out, saying they didn‚Äôt want their brands next to toxic content or political chaos. To make matters worse, some advertisers at Cannes said they‚Äôre still not confident in the platform. One person claimed they were told they had to hit a spending threshold or face a lawsuit. Still, Linda told advertisers that 96% of pre-acquisition clients are now back. She claimed X is close to recovering its full ad business from 2022.
